syllabus:
**Course Description**

This course introduces students to a wide range of semantic phenomena and issues in formal semantics, adopting a truth-conditional account of meaning. Topics covered include propositional and predicate logic, generalized quantifier theory, semantic inference relations, definite descriptions, genericity, and representation of NPs (including mass, collectives and bare plurals).

**Required Text**

A course reader compiled by the instructor.

**Course Requirements**

1.  Midterm (25%), Final (30%)

\--The midterm and final will cover lectures, discussions in class, and/or reading assignments. There will be a review before each exam.

       2. Assignments (20%)

       3. Squib + presentation (15%)

       4. Attendance and participation (10%).
